lines.text: I've discovered a very peculiar thing about money. It's valuable only if you spend it.
Your compliments are like fish hooks, Monsieur. they are tipped with barbs.
Nothing is blowing up in you, except your blood pressure.
I always had a great big squash of a heart. The rest of me grew up later to match it.
But I can't go to jail! I'm a married man.
Then take your wife with you.
The time to doubt the sun will rise is after it has once failed.

[they will find you... ]
By then they may find only my thumb securely glued to the end of my nose.
I've always believed that it's rather nice for a husband and wife to keep in touch with each other.
Pity is an epitaph for puny creatures, and that I am not... pity is only despising, coated with a sugar of sympathy.
